Content: [dscrd-hush] <Takoy_Nahal> In any case, it will be better if HUSH does not depend on a single exchange.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <Andreas> Will HUSH push for a Marketing Campaign now that HUSH 2.0 is out?
Maybe worth waiting until Cryptopia enables trading, but we can use that time to prepare the campaign.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> @Andreas its a community driven project so if you would like to contribute materials for a marketing campaign im sure the team will be happy to use them!

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Takoy_Nahal agreed. I believe the time of relying on Cryptopia is coming to an end. They responded to us, but we still have no instructions from them, on how to restart trading. I think they are overloaded with many of their coins being attacked

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> There is a new feature of DPoW called "dpowconfs" which I am in the process of porting from KMD to Hush, it's something that specifically for exchanges

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it's a way of making it trivial, no code changes for an exchange, to protect against double spends. they just use a new CLI option when starting: `hushd -dpowconfs`

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> dpowconfs changes the meaning of "confirmations", to make them aware of DPoW. What it means, is that confirmations will never go above 1 until a transaction is notarized

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> so confirmations=1 means not notarized, confirmations > 1 means notarized. Since all exchanges wait for more than 1 confirmation, their systems will only work on notarized transactions, if they turn on dpowconfs

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> without that, exchanges need to do lots of extra work/code to check if something is notarized, which isn't going to happen realistically, in many cases

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> makes it as simple as possible for an exchange to protect against double spends

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> Keep being a wizard Duke! 😃

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it was jl777 that came up with DPoW confs, I am just a journeyman. I helped port dpowconfs from Komodo `fsm` branch to `master`, which helped me learn the insides

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <Andreas> @RunningMantheCoin Ah man... I hate to say this, but HUSH used to have a "marketing team" and they were telling us for the last 1 year!! that it doesn't make sense to market a product until it's released. Now it's released, but the marketing team is long gone :D
I'm not trying to bash anyone about this, but saying that it's a community project is like pointing fingers to nowhere.
Noone in the community will want to put in serious effort in Marketing as most of us only own a small amount of HUSH, so there is no  incentive to do it. And the community does not have access to make changes or post on the twitter account, website, facebook page, etc.

I think we are back to the orignal problem. That is: there is no budget for anything as the mining rewards go 100% to the miners.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> @Andreas the community does have access to the twitter account & website. They are updated quite frequently so im unsure when you've last updated yourself. I do agree that its tough to have a marketing presence with no budget- But @Berg is now part of the core team and is working on a variety of efforts

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Andreas> Yeah...I admit I haven't checked the twitter for a while.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> & HUSH 2.0 is not the product release which was talked about. Thats HUSH-NG. Hush 2.0 is Hush with Dpow implemented

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> Its one of the few coins that are protected from 51% attacks

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Andreas> Ah.... I though HUSH 2.0 and HUSH-NG are the same

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> To my knowledge, Hush-NG is going to be a new interface which is very simple to use. New GUI that the ordinary consumer is able to use. Right now the swing wallet is only for the hardcore fans

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <Andreas> May I ask why the HUSH team is so much against introducing a 10% "tax" from the mining rewards?
That would solve all the problems this project has.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> Also, since @dukeleto is part of the core Komodo team, he has tons of connections that will surely be able to help us down the road in  releasing said GUI. The lead dev on Komod is @jl777c  who i believe is the single largets holder of Hush

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> The mining rewards is a question that im unable to answer unforutnatley. I do agree that a "founders reward" of some sort would be helpful. For example in Bitcoin Hush (BTCH) they are implementing staking and will stake the BTCH founders bag in order to earn rewards which could then be used to pay devs just like founders rewards would

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Andreas> Yes, the strong relations with the Komodo team is a very big plus for HUSH. May be the single biggest reason to invest in this project.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> I would 100% agree

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> Hush takes a back seat to the KMD ecosystem as that is always the first priority. But it doesnt change the fact that HUSH has the deepest bench of hardcore devs that can push this farther and faster than any other team could

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> its just a matter of patience

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> As far as fundementals go, Hush is a grand slam home run. But you're correct that we do have some issues- like relying on one exchange for 95%+ of our liquidity, small budgets for marketing, etc

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> With Cryptopia not updating to HUSH 2.0 is has been furstrated for lots of Hodlers b/c it looks like the project is at a standstill. But there is no reason that Hush can do a 10-50x in the next alt season

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Andreas> Cryptopia will update their wallet sooner or later. I'm not worried about that part.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Andreas> The thing is: If they want to delist HUSH because it has low volume, they would still need to update and fix the wallet first so people can withdraw their HUSH. But if they put effort in it, then it actually doesn't hurt to keep it. Especially if dPow protects the chain. So I'm not worried about getting delisted. It's just a matter of time until trading will be enabled again.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> Most definitely. The update will come- but we are working hard to get listed on another exchange so we dont have to rely on one central exchange again

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> I think @Berg has applied to more than a dozen. The upcoming Sonox exchange is going to be listing Hush as well

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Andreas> I know 😃 I have submitted a "few" votes during the summer 😜

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> hahahah yes & thank you! 😃

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Berg> Yeah, I've been holding off on a full fledged marketing campaign for 2.0 since we're struggling with trade volume.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Takoy_Nahal> @dukeleto I fully agree that the more HUSH exchanges have the better, let them be small. Wait for more than a month while Cryptopia does something has become unacceptable

Content: [dscrd-hush] <Andreas> @Berg Oh wow 😃 good to know. Thanks Berg!
